data.title: No coalition land row: Phumtham
data.description: The dispute over land plots in Buri Ram

data.title: Court to decide on taking Thaksin case by Nov 22
data.description: The attorney general has submitted documents to the Constitutional Court regarding the case in which former prime minister  Thaksin Shinawatra  is accused of asserting  influence  over the Pheu Thai Party.

data.title: Govt denies Kittiratt shoo-in for BoT chief
data.description: The government has brushed aside reports of former finance minister  Kittiratt Na-Ranong  making the cut as new chairman of the  Bank of Thailand  (BoT) board, saying nothing has been made official yet.

data.title: 'London Model' to be used for road fees
data.description: The Transport Ministry aims to use the so-called "London Model" to collect traffic  congestion fees  in the inner areas of Bangkok.

data.title: Orphanage to lose licence over abuse
data.description: An orphanage foundation in Chiang Mai will have its licence revoked by the Social Development and Human Security Ministry (MSDHS) following a complaint alleging that its employees mistreated children between the ages of three and six, according to Minister Varawut Silpa-archa.

data.title: MoU on territorial dispute with Cambodia clarified
data.description: The 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) between Thailand and  Cambodia  regarding  territory  claimed by both sides in the Gulf of Thailand provides a framework for negotiations on two main subjects: maritime demarcation and economic benefits from the development of energy resources, said Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa.

data.title: PM courts US cash on trip
data.description: Thai diplomats have been urged to take a proactive approach to attracting foreign investors following Donald Trump

data.title: Israelis in Thailand urged to be vigilant
data.description: Israeli authorities have advised their nationals in Thailand to remain vigilant following reports that they might be targeted during the  Full Moon Party  on  Koh Phangan  this coming Friday, the Times of Israel reports.

data.title: Foreigner blamed for Pattaya crash death
data.description: PATTAYA - A foreign woman has been arrested for crashing her car into a motorcycle, killing one person and injuring another.

data.title: Chinese illegals busted near Myanmar border
data.description: KANCHANABURI - Twenty foreigners — 18 Chinese men and two Lao women — have been arrested in Sangkhla Buri district for staying illegally in the country, police said on Tuesday.

data.title: illegal migrants caught heading for jobs in Malaysia
data.description: SONGKHLA - Twenty-four illegal migrants from Myanmar wanting to get jobs in Malaysia, a Thai driver and a Myanmar intermediary were arrested by police in Hat Yai district on Tuesday.

data.title: Extra public holidays next year approved
data.description: The cabinet has approved extra public holidays for next year and January 2026, declaring long-weekends to boost tourism and the overall economy.

data.title: Police round up crypto-mining power thieves
data.description: Police and electricity authorities have raided buildings in Chachoengsao and Surat Thani provinces, arrested suspects and seized  cryptocurrency mining  machines that stole tens of millions of baht worth of  electricity .

data.title: Woman killed by elephant at kathin ceremony
data.description: A woman was killed and two other people seriously injured by an agitated young elephant during a merit ceremony in the northeastern province of Bueng Khan.

data.title: Forestry employee arrested for rosewood theft
data.description: A forestry employee has been arrested in Udon Thani after intruders attacked staff and  stole 19 phayung logs  and two guns from a  forest conservation unit  in Sakon Nakhon province on Saturday.

data.title: Forest policeman arrested for rosewood theft
data.description: A former  forestry policeman  has been arrested in Udon Thani after intruders attacked staff and stole 19 phayung logs  and two guns from a  forest conservation unit  in Sakon Nakhon province on Saturday.

data.title: Rosewood logs stolen, arrest warrant for forest policeman
data.description: An arrest warrant has been issued for a member of the forestry police after armed men attacked staff and stole 19 phayung logs and two guns from a forest conservation unit in Sakon Nakhon province on Saturday.

data.title: Lawyer Sittra's employees held in B39m theft case
data.description: Police have arrested a couple employed by accused lawyer Sittra Biabungkerd, who is being held in police custody on charges of colluding to steal 39 million baht from a Thai woman who won a huge Euromillions lotto jackpot.

data.title: Bhumjaithai minister backs dept in SRT land row
data.description: Deputy Interior Minister Songsak Thongsri on Monday defended a land committee decision not to revoke land title documents issued for plots of land in Buri Ram’s Khao Kradong area.

data.title: Government defends Thaksin's role
data.description: Former prime minister  Thaksin Shinawatra  has the full legal right to assist in  Pheu Thai Party

data.title: BJT minister backs dept in SRT land row
data.description: Deputy Interior Minister Songsak Thongsri yesterday defended a land committee decision not to revoke land title documents issued for plots of land in Buri Ram’s Khao Kradong area.

data.title: Cooperation deal with Italy 'in the pipeline'
data.description: Thailand and Italy are working on a memorandum of understanding (MoU) on agricultural cooperation that will cover production, trade and investment, according to Agriculture and Cooperatives Minister Narumon Pinyosinwat.

data.title: Police seize 5m-plus meth pills in Saraburi
data.description: More than five million methamphetamine pills, one of the biggest hauls in recent months, have been confiscated in Saraburi, according to Provincial Police Region 1.
